titleStmt.title: A Crambo on Ballyspellin,
a Place in Ireland, fam'd for

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: To the Tune of Sally in our Ally.
All you that wou'd Refine your Blood,
As pure as fam'd Luellin,By Waters clear;Come once a Year
To drink at Ballyspellin.2.
If Pox or Itch Your Skins inrich
With Rubies past the telling;'Twill cure your Skin,Before you've been,
A Month at Ballyspellin.3.
If Lady's Cheek Be green as Leek
When she comes from her Dwelling,The kindling RoseWithin it blows
When she's at Ballyspelling.4.
The sooty Brown That comes from Town
Grows here as fair as Hellen;Then back she goesTo kill the Beaux,
By Dint of Ballyspelling.5.
All Ladies here Are fresh and fair
As Ross, or bright Dunkellin;And Mars might makeA fair Mistake,
Were he at Ballyspellin.6.We Men submitAs they think fit,
And here is no rebelling;The Reason's plain,The Lady's reign,
They're Queens at Ballyspellin.7.By matchless CharmsUnconquer'd Arms
They have the Power of quellingSuch desperate FoesAs dare oppose
Their Power at Ballyspellin.8.Cold Water turnsTo Fire, and burns,
I know, because I fell inA Stream which cameFrom one bright Dame,
Who drank at Ballyspellin.9.Fine Beaux advanceEquipt for Dance,
And bring their Ann or Nell in,With so much Grace,I'm sure no place
Can vie with Ballyspellin.10.No Politicks,No subtle Tricks,
No Man his Country selling,We eat, we drink,We never think
Of these at Ballyspellin.11.The troubl'd in MindThe puff'd with Wind,
Do all come here Pell-mell in,And they are sureTo work their Cure,
By drinking Ballyspellin.12.If Dropsy fillsYou to the Gills,
From Top to Toe tho' swelling,Pour in, pour out,You'll find, no doubt,
A Cure at Ballyspellin.13.Thro' all these PartsDeath throws no Darts,
No Sexton's here a Knelling;Come judge and tryYou'll never die,
But live at Ballyspellin.14.Except you feelDarts tipt with Steel,
Which here are ev'ry Belle in,When from their EyesSweet Ruin flies,
We die at Ballyspellin.15.Good Cheer, sweet Air,Much Ioy, no Care,
Your Taste, your Sight, your Smelling,Your Ears, your Touch,Transported much
Each day at Ballyspelling.16.Within this Ground,All Folks sleep sound,
No noisy Dogs a yelling,Except you wake,For Caelia's Sake,
All night at Ballyspellin.17.Here All you see,Both he and she,
No Lady keeps her Cell in,But all partakeThe Mirth we make
Who drink at Ballyspellin.18.My Rhimes are gone,I think I'Â·ve none,
Except I should bring Hell in;But since I'm here,To Heav'n so near,
I can't at Ballyspellin.438-321L
